tool.name: QuanTP
tool.description: Correlation between protein and transcript abundances

param.name: sample_type
param.label: Select data input type
param.help: If the input files already have fold-change values, select Log fold-change. Else, select abundances and the tool will perform the fold-change analysis
param.option: Abundances from different conditions with or without replicates (in multiple columns)
Log fold-change values (or single condition abundance without replicates in single column) data

param.name: exp_design
param.help: Please check the format of the experiment design file
param.label: Experiment design File (Please see the format below)

param.name: method_type
param.label: Data summarization method
param.help: Perform T-Test on selecting Mean; Wilcoxon Ranksum Test on selecting Median

param.name: volcano_with
param.label: Volcano plot with p-value or adjusted p-value

param.name: cooksd_upper
param.label: Influential Observation cutoff: Observations > value * mean of Cook's distances (Default: "4" * mean(Cook's Distance))

param.name: hm_nclust
param.label: Hierarchical clustering: Number of clusters (from Heatmap)

tool.help:
**What it does**
QuanTP correlates *transcript abundance* and *protein abundance* to examine the association between them.
It either takes in the log fold-change of abundances as input or raw abundances from different conditions where it calculates the log ratios of abundances between two conditions.
Transcript input file can be generated from the quantitative RNA-Seq study whereas Protein input file can be generated from quantitative analysis of mass-spectrometry-based protein data.
-----
**Input file formats**
**Protein data file**
First column - Gene
Following columns - Abundance values (or log fold-change values)
Example of Protein input file
====== ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= Gene sample1 sample2 sample3 sample4 sample5 sample6 sample7 sample8 ------ --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- GeneX value value value value value value value value GeneY value value value value value value value value GeneZ value value value value value value value value ====== ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= =========
**Transcript data file**
First column - Gene
Following columns - Abundance values (or log fold-change values)
Example of Transcript input file
====== ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= Gene sample1 sample2 sample3 sample4 sample5 sample6 sample7 sample8 ------ --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- --------- GeneX value value value value value value value value GeneY value value value value value value value value GeneZ value value value value value value value value ====== ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= ========= =========
**Data input type**
If data input type is abundance, experiment design file is required.
Example of experiment design file
======== ========= case groupA control groupB sample1 groupA sample2 groupA sample3 groupA sample4 groupA sample5 groupB sample6 groupB sample7 groupB sample8 groupB ======== =========
Note: No title/header in experiment design file and the first two lines of the experiment design must have keyword "case" and "control"
